Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as fc84f634d20eb9e90b39e251953628cbe2fe304f
remove this function name from trace 'TransferDataHost'
from where UPSTREAM tag will be picked?
I did it for consistency in logs, as it was little unclear what is being printed so  for error printing made this change.

1.make trace align with other trace at line no:287.
2.print file path also value.fsPath to enhance tracing.

why this change required?
please check for other traces also.
I did it for consistency in logs, as it was little unclear what is being printed so for error printing made this change.
there are multiple 'Unknown file type' similar kind of traces which confused developer, could you please enhance traces.

I agree this trace is at multiple places but developer can use json for more details like line number, file it is coming from and more info to do the exact debugging. Other than this what enhancement is required, I can do please let me know?
Unknown File Type. Read/write of file into memory stopped. - we use this , it will allow us to understand the we failed rwFileByTypeIntoMemory. Can we follow this for all Unknown file type traces?
I think for this log which is present in various places in the repo, additional information like where(file name, function name & line number) it occurred can be taken from journal json.
c_str not required, please check without it thorough out the Patch
please remove class name and rephrase it better way all over the file/patch
why this change is here? what is the relevance?

you could mention "failed with error number:{ERROR_NUM}".
since exception and error number are different here.
could you print offset value and file size.
adding a note as done if you have addressed this review comment helps to not recheck previous review comments
ignore this :) did not see the "Done"
Do not use host, since word is not relevant to community. remove host and reframe it everywhere.

Actually , we could have term `host` in oem code , its okay. Just never wanted to have term `host` in generic pldm code.

But its preferaable to use word `remote pldm terminus` instead of word `host`.
Do we really need to use the word "Downstream" here?
I reframed it based on my understanding of the earlier log string, I tried to preserve important info in the log. If any log doesn't seem making enough sense please suggest required change.

the original trace says lseek failed and adds the name of function for better debug. You dont need to use the word downstream/upstream in a sentence. "Downstream data transfer between BMC and Host with lseek upstream at offset failed " <<- this is confusing. 

Data transfer between BMC and host(or more generic word for host) failed with lseek failure. UPSTREAM= ....

Frame the trace in a better way
what does file write uptstream mean here? can we add a more generic phrase here?

"File_Handle does not exist" didn't make any sense better reframe it like this:
"File '{PATH}' does not exist with file handle '{FILE_HANDLE}'"
Packet length is a non multiple of minimum DMA size
do we need to print the length and offset also here?
I think it is okay as the log says unable to read.
Add length and offset here. Should not harm anything
I feel the word certificate is added here randomly. "Cannot find file type '{TYPE}' in map. Write from memory during certificate exchange failed" - does this sound better?

Sure I can but just saying 'map' becomes little generic? Certificate Map is should be better I think ? Additionally please correct me - 'file type' in string can also be replaced with 'certificate type'?

you can add Certificate map. 
what do u mean by certificate type? there is no such thing right?

I dont think we need to add the word Certificate here. We can frame the sentence in a better way. In this case - "Read file response for Sign CSR failed. file handle: {FILE_HANDLE}" will suffice because Sign CSR is done during certificate exchange only
can we frame these traces in a better way?

I understand we removed CertHandler. Please try to frame these traces in a better way. Check if this change applied for all traces with "Certificate" used in the beginning. The intention is to make add a trace that will help us debug faster
I agree. I can change the logs similar to the once where you already suggested reformatting. Can you please do it in other places too.
Change this trace. Difficult to understand

Change this trace also. 
"Failed to open new available file which filetype is'{}'...."

does it sound better?
So there is no significance of New file available step that happens in file transfer flow? I should remove it in other places too?
yes, reword like above sentence for better readability.

Failed to make a D-bus call to DUMP manager for reseting source dump file:'{PATH}' which source Dump ID is: '{ID}'

rephrase like this for better readability.
please make similar thing for below some of the traces.
we are printing in hex so do we still need to append "0x"?
what is file seek? there is not concept of file seek, please improve trace
I think u should keep this as HostReject here. HostReject is the dbus object
I did not understand, are you suggesting omitting the PATH ?
change the sentence to file open failed or failed to open file
please print object path, interface path here.
printing invalid magic number but printing path? please improve trace.

since this commit is improvement of trace then why other code change is required? 
please undo this change and do as part of separate commit.

rephrase it like: 
"Failed to open unix socket"
"Failed listen() call while setting up unix socket"
"Failed select() call while setting up unix socket"
"Failed accept() call while setting up unix socket"
can you please print SourceDumpId which here are searching?

So we will enter the else part only when dumpIdPtr == nullptr  and if I am printing that value(*nullptr) stored at the location(which is null) held by this pointer, it doesn’t make sense as it will be junk.
can you please include full interface name?
there is no severity related logs are there, all severity related log has been removed from upstream.
I was implying by severity level of logs is using error, info, etc. appropriately and corrected it for logs wherever required.
can you add at what position lseek failed?
can you add at what position and length read failed?
can you please move this error line at line 293, bcz if it's stuck at sendStateSensorEvent then we could get atleast ffdc log first.
can you print what path and it's size it long for socket?
if you print err no then easy to know why it's failed instead of guessing out of 3 err code.

looks like confusing log to me.
you can rephase it like:"Failed to setup Unix socket while write from memory for interface{}"
can you print interface dumpIntf  here?
can you print what socketInterface path and addr.sun_path for comparison?
Done, addr.sun_path not included as before being populated(which happens after the if-condition) it will just be undefined or junk value.
